results.title: Animals hear in many ways
results.creator_credit: Norman Bean, Film Associates of California and Norman Bean Films
results.brief_description: Animals hear when sound vibrations produce similar vibrations in their own bodies. This film shows how different parts of animals’ bodies may be specially adapted to receive the vibrations. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norman Bean, Film Associates of California and Norman Bean Films

results.title: Animals can bite
results.creator_credit: John Hart, John Hart Films and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Instructs children on how to avoid being bitten by animals encountered on the street and what to do when someone is bitten by any kind of animal. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Animals at work in nature
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Dancy and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explains that animals have highly-specialised body parts which enable them to adapt to their environment. With close-up photography, shows animals building homes, raising their young, and acquiring and storing food. Includes scenes of a woodpecker drilling in the bark of a tree, a mosquito sucking blood from a farmer’s arm, caterpillars spinning a web, ants carrying heavy loads of food, a caddis fly glueing materials together for its home, and beavers building a dam.

results.title: Animal olympians
results.brief_description: Fascinating comparisons are made between human Olympic skills and feats in the animal world. Shows many animal performances such as breath-held depth diving, animal marksmen, gliding, speed flying, soaring and hovering.
results.description: Fascinating comparisons are made between human Olympic skills and feats in the animal world. Shows many animal performances such as breath-held depth diving, animal marksmen, gliding, speed flying, soaring and hovering.

results.title: Animal husbandry
results.creator_credit: John C. Elder and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: A detailed study of livestock farming in Scotland; locations are indicated by maps; statistical charts are shown; marketing is shown at a tyupical local market; daily work on various farms is shown, including farms specialising in sheep, beef cattle, dairy cattle and pigs.
results.description: A detailed study of livestock farming in Scotland; locations are indicated by maps; statistical charts are shown; marketing is shown at a tyupical local market; daily work on various farms is shown, including farms specialising in sheep, beef cattle, dairy cattle and pigs.

results.title: Animal health field stations
results.brief_description: Research at the CSIRO Animal Research Laboratory at Parkville, Melbourne, is aimed at maintaining the health of sheep, cattle, pigs and poultry improving their productive performance. To succeed with this program the Laboratory has field stations at Maribyrnong, Werribee and Seymour, where animals can be reared free of specified diseases.

results.title: Animal friends
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: Roll-call in the Rockies: In Banff National Park census takers on horseback count animals. results.title: Animal behaviour: a first film
results.creator_credit: Norman Bean and Norman Bean Films
results.brief_description: Animals have behaviour patterns that are caused by stimuli. The film is open ended as the viewer is left to work out the stimuli for various types of behaviour. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
results.description: Animals have behaviour patterns that are caused by stimuli. The film is open ended as the viewer is left to work out the stimuli for various types of behaviour. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Animal behaviour
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Chris O'Rourke and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Stewart Jackel, senior education officer of Zoo Education Services, and Year 12 students from Prahran High School discuss the adaptive nature of animal behaviour and the ways in which animal structures are used to assist survival.
